poem:
Ceasefire Fractured

In the trembling dawn,  
a delicate thread unravels—  
powdered smoke traces  
the whispered absence of peace.

Talousa's rooftops weep  
crimson tears in morning light,  
while Haris wraps itself  
in silent loss.

Words flit  
like startled sparrows,  
but stillness cedes—  
hope wilts beneath  
a battered sky.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ceasefire on edge after deadly Israeli strikes in southern Lebanon | First Thing Good morning. The ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah appears increasingly at risk after the two sides traded fire and accused each other of breaching the truce less than a week after it came into force. The Israeli military said it struck dozens of Hezbollah targets throughout Lebanon. Israeli strikes on two southern Lebanese towns, Talousa and Haris, killed nine people and injured". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
